review_title: Great place to work. I will be back.
job_title: Patient Service Specialist I in Springfield, IL
pros: Flexible. Good benefits. Caring staff. Caring bosses. Good HR
cons: Had an issue with a man anger bullying people. That was addressed very Weill though.

review_title: Outside recruiter gave me incorrect information
job_title: Clinical Documentation Specialist RN in Springfield, IL
pros: I was offered a very good salary. Hiring manager very patient in offering me the position until I got my Illinois RN license restored, which took 2 months. Orientation to this position is excellent with online modules and at-the-shoulder training.
cons: The recruiter made a major error. She during her initial contact with me in October she told me there was a $15,000 sign on bonus with this position. We discussed this several time over the 2 months as she worked with me to secure this position, and each time she said there was a bonus. When the offer letter came there was no mention of this bonus. I called, texted, and emailed the recruiter so I could get this cleared up. I never heard from her. I was finally contacted by the hospital HR rep who told me that this position did not have a bonus attached because it was not a bedside RN job. Suffice to say, this was very disappointing. I wanted to work in this field, so I did not turn down the job. I just wished the recruiter knew what she was talking about because I was planning to pay off my car loan with this money.

pros: They do offer competitive pay in most positions
cons: Very sad culture shift over the years (even prior to COVID), lack of appreciation (outside of posting it on workplace and random lunch days), treated like you are a dime a dozen no matter how much time you have invested in their company (matter of fact no skin off their back if you leave, they can pay a new grad cheaper), you are a scapegoat for their "money lost", and need I not mention the salary the suits and higher ups/management (because leadership does NOT exist)make yearly, the expectation is you work more and exhaust yourself for them ultimately to make them more money, failure to acknowledge this poor culture they have created has resulted in the loss of great veteran providers and nurses as well as other staff resulting in a continued snow ball effect of working short, demands for more hours worked by you in short staffed environments, patronizing and condescending comments galore. Absolutely nauseating. No longer a great place to work no matter how much money.

pros: Memorial Health is a great place to build your career. No matter what your skill level is, Memorial Health is great at work with you to advance in your career. The management teams are wonderful and have an open-door policy, they are part of your team and listen when you have an idea or concern. The colleagues work together to make thing run smoothly and care for the patients' needs in a timely manner. There are so many Pros for working for Memorial Health. The pay and compensation are considered constantly and updated when needed.
cons: Parking can be an issue. The parking lots are a little way to walk. Bring your umbrella and dress warm when you need to. There are some closer parking spots, but they are hard to get.

pros: Professional Development Work/Life balance Institutional strength Colleague opportunities
cons: Slow to adopt new trends Slow to increase productivity

pros: Pay check, and some good staff.
cons: There are not enough SME's here.

review_title: Thoughts about Springfield Memorial Hospital from a Colleague of the Month
job_title: RN Infection Preventionist in Springfield, IL
pros: SMH is more than an employer to me it is a symbol of stability for the community. I have been a nurse for over 35 years and have held many nursing roles here at SMH. I have left several times to pursue other interests that may not have been offered here but I have never found the grass to be as green as it is here. Here I feel empowered to provide care that makes me proud to be a nurse.
cons: The downside to working in SMH is no different than situations in hospitals across the nation.

pros: Large system can transfer to another location
cons: Poor onboarding process and support Does not value the APP’s No financial support for continue Education, DEA, license

job_title: Mobile Crisis Response Lead Clinician in Springfield, IL
pros: Working with people in need provides me with personal joy and fulfillment. Memorial Behavioral Health's Mobile Crisis team removes a barrier to treatment by meeting those in crisis where every they are. My role at Memorial allows me to work in my community creating real-time change. I have the opportunity to support so many people and create wonderful relationships with my colleagues and community.
cons: It's a big system so keeping up with all the changes can be hard at times.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Springfield, IL
pros: Lots of friendly and knowledgeable people to help when needed.
cons: Employee parking is pretty far away from the building. I understand the need to leave parking for the patients, but walking to the building in inclement weather is rough.

job_title: Referral Specialist I in Jacksonville, IL
pros: Having had opportunity in many areas of the health system has been a most valuable learning experience. Over the years, seeing how various departments roles play into patient care helped me see the big picture in it all
cons: there have been management issues that I have witnessed in the past where it took a long time to be addressed but eventually were

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Springfield, IL
pros: Easy to obtain healthy lifestyle if desired, minimal stress compared to SNF, consistent schedule.
cons: Wage per hour, however, based on job list new wage is more appropriate.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Springfield, IL
pros: Good parking, easy to self schedule
cons: Can be short staffed, work is hard!

job_title: Unarmed Security Officer in Decatur, IL
pros: I get to work with and around heroes. People who come to work everyday wanting to make peoples lives better. Every day I get opportunities to make someone's day better. You must be a people person to thrive.
cons: Long twelve hour shifts can sap one's strength. Hopefully the days go by quickly. Large mental strain when dealing with certain types of personalities. Patience and tolerance are a must. I wish I was paid more. Job can be dangerous at times.

job_title: Medical Informatics Consultant II in Springfield, IL
pros: There are many reasons why I find myself to be blessed to be a part of Memorial. In my support role, I get a chance to help providers be more efficient with their time on the computer. I get to help solve a lot of problems and build relationships with these providers. I am also fortunate to have a great leader who has helped me grow in this role and supports me at all times.
cons: I cannot list any cons at this time.

pros: People are friendly and always willing to help others.
cons: Training is too fast and not organized, whatsoever but I need the experience so that's why I'm here.

pros: It is a great environment to learn and grow! Everyone is so very helpful!
cons: I don't have any cons at this point.

review_title: Memorial Health is a great place to develop leadership skills.
pros: The Memorial Health culture provides opportunity for career growth and development. Memorial strives to deliver the best patient care experiences to our patients and their families. Quality and safety are at the forefront of every decision.
cons: Memorial Health has many opportunities for employment, so there are a lot of career choices. This may make it difficult to decide the right route entry level applicants.

review_title: Great first year!  Looking forward to many more at Memorial Health!

pros: I have been with Memorial Helath for almost 7 years. I have been able to work myself up from the trenches and been promoted into HR. Not many places have the options to move like Memorial Health does. The management and the staff are always great and so helpful.
cons: Not many cons in my opinion. Memorial really took care of their colleagues during the pandemic.

pros: I was laid off during COVID. I miss working here. It was a great experience.

pros: overall a good paying workplace

pros: Decent food, decent teamwork, lots of things to learn if your just starting out.
cons:
Oh boy where to start:
*lots of bullying by team members
*constant rule changes
*NO WAY TO SWITCH SHIFTS
*some shifts refuse to help each other
* pay is below average
*management is almost never helpful
*many people last less then a year
*constant harassment by nurses and doctors
*they offer to help schedule around schooling but then don't.
*rasies are very small and only once a year
*advancement takes forever
*lack of consistency with training new people
* and there is more but this is the gist of it.

job_title: Clinical Systems Analyst in Springfield, IL
pros: People there are very caring, considerate, respectful. I really enjoy working here and I think it will be a great place to move up over several years.
cons: The best things about Memorial is also one of its biggest detractors. There are a lot of people who have made Memorial their career and have not had any experiences outside of there. Lots of folks that have spent 20 to 40 years there. That gives people a great historical perspective of the organization but also gets in the way to doing new things because that "isn't how we've always done it".

pros: Coworkers are nice and engaging, opportunities to learn, large campus, consistently meet new people
cons: There is limited career advancement within my department and transferring to a different department is difficult because of the selection process. Even with a degree and qualifying, the chances are still very challenging. They may/will even hire someone who is less qualified to fill the position.  Also, the pay is low and raises are not much. Scheduling can also be a problem at times.

review_title: My work experience at Memorial Hospital
pros: The People are Great to work with!
cons: Policies implemented by administration are not practiced before implemented and are not always ideal. Administration does not care about this fact, even though employees have brought to attention on what does work, and what will work.

pros: Decent pay, benefits, good clinical staff. Computer charting & order entry.
cons: Understaffed. Indifferent upper management will not listen to needs of those "in the trenches". Difficult to provide decent patient care due to work load. Constantly being called to come in on days off due to understaffing. The image portrayed to the public is not the reality within.

review_title: Disorganized, Understaffed, Compensation has nothing to do with ability or productivity
job_title: IT (I Will Not Specify) in Springfield, IL
pros:
This hospital is a decent first job if you're looking for generalized experience in a bureaucratic and unrealistic environment. You have to cut your corporate stooge teeth somewhere eh? You will gain experience in several areas, I'll list just a few for substance: 
-You will learn to deal with unreasonable people
-You will learn to be condescending and/or passive aggressive as a defense mechanism
-You will learn that people making large quantities of money are ignorant
-You will learn that it literally is not what you know, it's who you know or how compelled you are to know just the right people in order to excel in your career. Your job is not to do your best, it's to keep the village elders from seeing your mistakes and/or short comings at all costs. You MUST blame the next guy. God forbid you take responsibility for anything, Lead By Example. Admit to nothing and insinuate that you attempted to offer a better solution but employee X just wouldn't have it. 
-You will learn to be defensive over any and all situations, for if you're not defensive, you'll be thrown under the bus.

These things are very important you know... Thank god Memorial taught me so well. I'm like Business Heman now.
cons:
-Memorial does not pay based on skill level or knowledge. Realistically no one knows what drives compensation at memorial. It's a situation with rules akin to any of the popular Dungeons and Dragons dice games without knowing who the dungeon master is. With several coworkers history in mind, it takes resigning to take a different job in order to be promoted. Years of work towards this goal is not sufficient regardless of how hard you work or how many hours you put in. You can "get lucky" and fall in to a position if someone is fired or quits, but it's really because you fill a specific need for the company. It has nothing to do with you being appreciated for your hard work.

-A high percentage of my fellow employees "talk" about working and actually consider it to be the act of working.

-Some of our employees refuse to learn new skills, which is ridiculous considering we work in IT.

review_title: Was wonderful until i went to 2c.  Bullying going on here.
pros: magnet hospital, good food.  pay is ok, benifits are ok, different areas to work in.  That is about all i have.
cons: Dont go by magnet protocol, large patient load, no relief for lunch break, management unavailable to hear concerns of staff.  Just does not care.

job_title: Had III Different Titles in Springfield, IL
pros: A lot of interesting cases and many chances to learn new things.  Great instrumentation and highly technical facility.  Leading the nation in it's practices.
cons: A lot of shift tension and employee unhappiness.  People are not treated the same.  A lot of back stabbing by management breeding hostility all around.

review_title: Could be great, but not great yet.
pros: Upper management has a passion and a vision for Memorial being a great place for patients and employees.  Memorial also has many excellent staff members, who are capable of great work.
cons: At the middle and low level IS management, there exists a serious deadlock (especially in the IS department) for progress.  Some staff are only there to gather a paycheck and are more than willing to do nothing.  With projects frequently blocked, some staff literally have nothing to do for extended periods of time.

review_title: Terrific seasonal position for employer who was responsive to employee needs.

pros: Job training provided professional leadership growth. Work hours fit into my studies driven time schedule. I will continue to utilize customer service skills as a museum professional.
cons: The compensation is hourly without benefits. The culture of the office included lots of turnover for health care contractors during my two years in the position.

job_title: Pharmacy Technician, Unit Support Attendant in Springfield, IL
pros:
-Awesome pay for the two positions I worked during my tenure
-Wonderful people (some awfully forgiving of mistakes-very thankful for that!)
cons:
-Infrastructure is half outdated; some places in the hospital were nice, others seemed straight out of a previous era
-Constantly changing work areas (this could be a pro as well, but in this case not so much), sometimes tough to find things
-Had a hard time cooperating with different departments (i.e - some nursing units; most were wonderful though)

pros: In general there are truly great caring people that work to serve patients.  The top leadership of the organization is very good and is consistently working hard to communicate.
cons: Too many demands on IS without a cohesive system-wide approach to the strategic plans of the entire organization rather than just functional areas.

review_title: No room for advancement, but supportive environment.
